content:
I think I found a bug in Zulip 1.6. Here is what I've done (all in electron but I believe the problem is with the server):

  • sent a longish instructional/announcy message with three screenshots to @ everyone on our server
  • msg had it's red background
  • I noticed a few typos and edited them
  • later I wanted to point someone again to that msg
  • so created a link to the msg and send it to that person
  • I clicked the link to see whether it would open in electron or browser (opened in electron)
  • after clicking the link I only saw the msg with white background as if it had no mention (not just in electron)
  • everyone else also now sees the msg as white even if they had no link to it

it seems that if you open a msg that you are mentioned in via link it loses it's red background colour which is a shame because it should keep standing out. Can someone else reproduce this? I don't want to mention everyone here.
not quite but maybe they are connected. I still have that message in my mentions but it's white
what sounds similar is that when clicking the link Zulip reloads (which it shouldn't really... just navigate to the message)
Doesn't it work like when you read the message, it turns white? As I think I remember having my mentioned messages turning white after a while.
@Matthias MÃ¼ller can you open an issue for this? It seems like a priority regression
